intro: Atalantia sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flowered atalantia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and broad, leathery leaves. It typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
